item.title: Israel recovers the bodies of 3 hostages
item.description: The three were identified as Shani Louk, Amit Buskila and Yitzhak Gelernter. Israel's military said they had been killed by Hamas militants when they attacked a music festival on Oct. 7.

item.title: Youth detention facilities face increased scrutiny amid a wave of abuse lawsuits
item.description: A new lawsuit alleges widespread sexual abuse of juveniles took place over decades at Illinois youth detention facilities. Similar lawsuits have been filed this year in other states.

item.title: Saving a Language in Chile
item.description: Ckunsa, an indigenous language in Chile, was declared dead 70 years ago. But groups in northern Chile are successfully reviving the language and teaching it to a new generation.

item.title: Mercedes workers vote no to union. UAW says they were illegally intimidated
item.description: More than 5,000 Mercedes-Benz workers who build luxury SUVs in Alabama were eligible to vote on whether to join the UAW. Workers faced intense anti-union messaging from Mercedes in the run-up.

item.title: Rafah is running out of food, even as the U.S. pier starts operating in Gaza
item.description: The first trucks of aid entered Gaza via a pier built by the U.S. But it's challenging to move aid around Gaza, and humanitarian groups operating in Rafah warn they don't have food to distribute.

item.title: Scottie Scheffler is arrested outside PGA Championship after interaction with police
item.description: Scheffler, who won the Masters last month, was arrested and charged after an interaction Friday morning with a police officer directing traffic into to the golf club where the PGA event is being held.
